edu.sdccd.cisc191

Class BookManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.sdccd.cisc191.BookManager

  • public class BookManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages a collection of books in a library system. Provides operations for adding, removing, sorting, and asynchronously loading books. Integrates with BookLinkedList for in-memory storage and BookDAO for database persistence.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BookManager()
      Constructs a new BookManager and loads books from the database asynchronously.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addBook(BookOrder book)
      Adds a new book to the library.
      javafx.collections.ObservableList<BookOrder> getBooks()
      Retrieves the list of books as an ObservableList.
      void loadBooksConcurrently()
      Loads books from the database asynchronously.
      void removeBook(BookOrder book)
      Removes a book from the library.
      void setBookLoaded(java.lang.Runnable bookLoaded)
      Sets a callback to be executed when books are successfully loaded.
      void sortBookByName()
      Sorts the in-memory book list alphabetically by book name.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • BookManager

        public BookManager()
        Constructs a new BookManager and loads books from the database asynchronously.

    • Method Detail

      • setBookLoaded

        public void setBookLoaded(java.lang.Runnable bookLoaded)
        Sets a callback to be executed when books are successfully loaded.
        Parameters:
        bookLoaded - a Runnable to execute upon successful book loading

      • loadBooksConcurrently

        public void loadBooksConcurrently()
        Loads books from the database asynchronously. Updates the in-memory book list upon successful loading and executes the bookLoaded callback if set.

      • getBooks

        public javafx.collections.ObservableList<BookOrder> getBooks()
        Retrieves the list of books as an ObservableList. Useful for integration with JavaFX UI components like ListView.
        Returns:
        an observable list of all books

      • addBook

        public void addBook(BookOrder book)
        Adds a new book to the library. Updates both the in-memory book list and the database.
        Parameters:
        book - the BookOrder to add

      • removeBook

        public void removeBook(BookOrder book)
        Removes a book from the library. Updates both the in-memory book list and the database.
        Parameters:
        book - the BookOrder to remove

      • sortBookByName

        public void sortBookByName()
        Sorts the in-memory book list alphabetically by book name. Updates the internal linked list to reflect the sorted order.
